Fields.DialogueText: *ALARM*
All crew report to your stations!
@BATTLE
Hmm... I'd need talent... someone who understands the material...

Fields.MenuText: Am I interrupting you, Fieramosca? I can always come by later.
What's this about talent? Working on something?
I don't know what's going on, but it better not distract you from the fight.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, but we can make the best of it. I'm trying to think of finding help for a personal project on the side.
It's nothing, really. I'm on the lookout for someone to help with something I'm working on.
I don't want to know why you'd even think of that, Capitano. Personal hobbies are not my top priority.
If you don't mind, Fieramosca, what are you working on?
I'll tell you... if you promise to not laugh at me.
I'd never do that. Now, Fieramosca. What is it that you're working on?
A movie script.
Never pictured you as a fan of movies, let alone writing.
Picture it. Italian cinema is groundbreaking. I've always wanted to tell a stirring story of my people through the silver screen!
Not wrong to have dreams, Fieramosca. If you need anything, I can help.
Grazie. Now, this dialogue could really use some punching up...
That includes you, Fieramosca!
Sì, sì, sì, sì, sì... I'll have to come back to this scene.
What scene? What are you writing?
Not important. Probably bound for the cutting floor anyway, but it puts some things in perspective during the creative process.
It's like digging a cave with a spoon...
*ALARM*
This is an ambush, Captain!
Give them everything we've got!
@BATTLE
Where did Fieramosca run off to?
Not sure. But we have a long list of fixes to do. Fieramosca is getting more expensive by the day...
She's worth it. Now, where did she go after the fight? I have a feeling you're not telling me.
She headed towards her usual secluded spot in the vessel.
I'll go check in.
Captain, I'd prefer it if you'd stay here. We need to talk.

Fields.MenuText: What's on your mind, Officer?
I guess Fieramosca can wait. What's the issue?
I'm guessing it has to do with Fieramosca...

Fields.DialogueText: It's about her attitude. She's starting to show her "ugly" side.
Fieramosca is the issue, Captain. The French Belles are starting to notice.
Of course it does. We can't let her go untethered. Her attitude towards the French Belles is getting worse.
What do you mean?
Fieramosca works well enough with her French sisters when they're around. But she's come dangerously close to collateral damage a few times. It's frequent enough to be a pattern.
I figured she was still harboring prejudice, but I was sure I'd gotten her to cool down a little.
Apparently not. Everyone is an asset. The last thing we need is to burn bridges... or allies.
I'll see what I can do. Might need to lose a few more olives here and there...
Watch yourself. With friends like these...
Who?
Il franchese. Che altro?
You again!? Damn it, I don't care if they're commanded by Enrico Dandolo himself! You can't trust-
Ahem.
Oh! It's you, Capitano.

Fields.MenuText: Whoa, calm down! Who were you expecting?
You seem really upset. Something happen?
Who shouldn't I trust?

Fields.DialogueText: Sorry, I thought you were that obnoxious officer...
What happened was that your officer proved willing to put the entire crew in danger!
At this rate, everybody! ... Except me.
You're really on edge...
I'm on edge because nobody else seems to be! You haven't seen some of the skulking harpies they're having me work with!
I don't see what the issue-
French vessels! You think we can turn our backs to them?
We're all on the same team, Fieramosca.
What about after the war? You really think they'll stay friends!? You can't trust them!
We've got to talk-
Sorry to interrupt, but Morganas inbound!
We'll sort this out later.
@BATTLE
Delays, delays...
It's been a while since we chatted.
I guess so.
You still want to talk to me about the French Belles? Had to save up the courage for the topic?

Fields.MenuText: No, I just don't want to talk to a child. Are you ever going to open up to the French?
Something like that. You're really willing to throw away potential allies because of something as ridiculous as prejudice?
Do you feel calm enough to have a conversation without snapping? Or is this going to be a recurring problem?

Fields.DialogueText: Brave of you to say that, Capitano. Don't count on me changing my views any time soon.
Of course I am. We don't need any other Belles around. Especially when you have the best one working with you.
If you treat me roughly, then expect more outbursts, Capitano. You can force me to sail into battle with the French girls, but I'll be looking over my shoulder the entire time.
So your solution is to cut people off completely?
Doesn't seem that bad of an idea to me.
What if it's your last resort? What if you come across a choice between accepting their help or certain death?
How certain is certain?
I'm not asking for you to agree with me, Capitano. Just understand that I have preferences. I can get the job done on my own.
Prove it. Better yet, don't.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Hmm...
Writing again?
Not really. I'm trying to think of inspiration to keep the creativity going...
Really? What were you thinking of?
Italian cinema. Some of the greatest films in the whole world are coming from home right now.

Fields.MenuText: Can't say I'm a huge film enthusiast. Can you recommend anything?

Fields.DialogueText: The Haller Case! It's the very last word in crime thrillers.

Fields.MenuText: Haven't heard of it. What's it about?
I may need you there with me to translate. I don't speak Italian.
I'll check it out sometime.

Fields.DialogueText: It's based on a play called Der Andere. A man leads a double life, and his ego causes him to spiral out of control.
How can you not know Italian? If I feel like it, maybe I'll teach you a few things.
Good. Check it out, take notes, and then tell me why it's an incredible story.
I'll look it up. Is that the kind of story you want to tell?
As much as I hate to end this interesting conversation, I'm trying to think about what to write, Capitano. Might I have some time to myself?
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Never mind. I'm sure I'll think of something when I'm trying to focus on other things.

Fields.MenuText: Ah. Are you a fan of Alessandro Blasetti, then?

Fields.DialogueText: You mean Backstage? Comedy's not my favorite genre, but--

Fields.MenuText: I mean the Ettore Fieramosca film he did in 1938 and you know it.
Didn't he do a movie about your namesake?
Really? The Telefoni Bianchi comedies seem to be everywhere...

Fields.DialogueText: I haven't seen it. It would be impossible for me to be unbiased.
I haven't seen it. It would be impossible for me to be unbiased.
So is candy. I still prefer a full meal. I can't fault the set designs, though.
Okay, so what do you like? Give me an example.
Morganas are close by, Capitano. Alert the crew.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
I can't believe the Morganas screwed up my - our - food supply. Again.
Don't expect that to change anytime soon. By the way, you've never told me what your script is about.
It's going to be about me, ovviamente!

Fields.MenuText: About you? Really? Why make a film about yourself?
Can't say I'm surprised.
Why not make a film about me? I could tell you some interesting stories.

Fields.DialogueText: There's already been a few, but none of them will do quite the justice of this one.
What's that supposed to mean!?
Now that would be a funny film! You want to be in a movie? Make one yourself!
You think your story really warrants a film?
A condottiero among condottieri! Hero of the Battle of Cerignola! Only the toughest Belle around would be worthy of his name.
How're you going to get help bringing it to life? I'm not sure that anyone would want to boost your ego.
First of all, it's not an issue of ego! I want people to know the truth! The only person I could trust is another Italian Belle!
Unless she stole your thunder.
Che cos 'era questo?
I said you're a whole wonder.
Are you all right, Fieramosca? You're looking a little pale.
Never you mind how I look! I'm still in this fight.
If you say so.
... Even without my precious Cerignola olives...
They're not the same as my Cerignolas!
You're the one who decided to skip breakfast. We've got olives, you know.
I want to make one about my namesake first. But once that one smashes the box office, it's on to me!
Your namesake the mercenary.
Right. Now, I know you remember that there was a film of his life made just back in-
1938. Si, lo so. But I didn't make it, did I? It's missing the insights only I could bring!
Point taken.
And this isn't hubris, Capitano. I dream about Ettore's adventures at night. I hear his voice when I listen for it. As a Bella, I was named for him, and you know the difference that makes!
What's that noise? Is that music?
Fieramosca? Are you playing something?
It's not mere music, Capitano! It should be treated with more respect! It is art!
Okay... what is it, exactly?
Vincenzo Ferroni! Are you really that uncultured?

Fields.MenuText: Sorry. It doesn't sound familiar to me. I'm guessing you take his work seriously.
No need to be rude, Fieramosca. I'm just trying to have a conversation. Now, who is that?
Of course I know who it is! It was a test... and you passed.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course I do! Ferroni is one of the best composers out there!
Don't be so fragile! When you're not educated on your Italian composers, I have to go all out!
If it were really a test, Capitano, I assure you I would have.
First films, now this? You really are a different Belle...
Not what I seem to be? I'm more than just a war machine. I have my interests.
I just didn't picture you as a fan of music.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Suono infernale! We really must get a better alarm...
Of course I like music! It's just one way the world can experience the greatness of my homeland.
Not everyone likes opera.
Then they can experience Italy's greatness at the mercy of the Regia Marina.
*ALARM*
Fieramosca, be careful!
You should see me when I'm being reckless. It's not my fault if you can't keep up!
@BATTLE
The Morganas have been dealt with, but we may have taken some bad internal damage from that last encounter...
I'm... fine...
You don't look it, ma'am...
I told you that I'm okay! Just fix me up and I'll be good to go!
Send some of the crew to check out the damage. I want to know how serious it is.
It's not serious! We don't need backup. I'm fine on my own! It's just that I didn't eat today!

Fields.MenuText: You're obviously damaged, Fieramosca! Don't jeopardize the entire crew because you want fine food.
Sooner or later you're going to have to get over yourself, Fieramosca! Let us help you!
Last time I checked, I'm the captain. We're going to find out if you're able to continue on missions.

Fields.DialogueText: Fine! Understand that there is nothing to worry about!
If I am well enough to insist otherwise, there is no need! You'll see...
I'm never going to let you or my nation down, Capitano. Count on that.
Anything?
Captain, she's... a little bruised, but nothing some time in port can't fix. I thought for sure...
See? I ought to make you pay for the next suitable meal I have. Whenever that might be.
If it's good enough for the crew, it's good enough for the Belle.
Why, how dare you! I'll have you know-
You can eat your potatoes like the rest of us, Fieramosca. Unless you'd like a turn at peeling them.
That's... I... Grr. Sei una patata.
You're not looking too good, Fieramosca.
No, I don't suppose I am! I wonder why that might be?
I bolted down that slop you call breakfast. It's the fault of the crew this time! They can't move fast enough, Capitano.

Fields.MenuText: Passing the blame needs to stop, Fieramosca. Now. I need you to pull it together.
It doesn't matter if it's their fault or not. You find a way to manage with it. You're having trouble doing the latter.
I know you're afraid of letting everyone down, but...

Fields.DialogueText: With all due respect, Capitano... I'd appreciate it if you'd let me handle things myself. I'm capable.
Don't you try to pin these things on me. You're just about as responsible!
Not another word. You're the last person I want to hear this from at this moment.
You're flustered, Fieramosca. War takes its toll on everyone. What you're experiencing is the same thing the crew goes through.
So they're being threatened to be taken off missions as well? Not in fighting shape?
Morganas inbound!
I'll show you that I can still fight. And when I win, I'd better get the recognition I deserve!
By which you mean those olives you like so much.
@BATTLE
Am I going to have to bully you into eating properly?
As a start!
Fieramosca says Morganas are approaching fast.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
We've gone through some of the damage that Fieramosca took.
How bad is it? Is she going to be okay?
There's some bad scrapes and dents, a puncture or two... nothing too bad. She's lucky, but her recklessness doesn't help. And...
And?
She keeps straining herself. The way she wants to operate is dangerous. We're in a submarine. We're not meant to charge dead on and collide with the enemy.

Fields.MenuText: What do you recommend? She's hardly feeling friendly at the moment.
I agree. Want me to talk to her?
No way around this issue, is there?

Fields.DialogueText: I recommend you see what's bothering her. War does heavy damage to your consciousness if left unchecked...
You read my mind. Try to calm her down. She trusts you the most. She'll listen to you.
Unless you want to have Fieramosca unable to fight, then there's no other way. Talk to her when you get the chance.
No promises, but I'll see what I can do.
Thank you, Captain.
At least she's paying attention.
Of course I am! You're supposed to be on my side, Capitano.
I might be the one force keeping your side from the bottom of the ocean.
Hey!
You're talking about me. I don't like it when people talk about me.
I never would have guessed. You're the one who wants to be in pictures.
Hard to concentrate on my script when I have to listen for the final scuttle order.
We're just talking maintenance. You've got nothing to fear from us.
I want to believe you. I really do. It's just...
Just what?
... It's like writing that script. It'll come to me.
Are you down here alone, Fieramosca? I can hear your music. I want to talk.
I'm here, Capitano. I was about to come and find you... and apologize.
Apologize? For what?
For getting carried away with you. I had to prove to everyone that I can fight.
There's nothing to apologize for. You've been stressed, same as me.
Right... so why are you here? Got sent by someone to put me in my place?

Fields.MenuText: I was just told to check up on you and to see if you're holding up okay.
Believe it or not, I was hoping to get a lesson in Italian cinema from you.
Just thought I'd keep you company. Maybe you could tell me more about your favorite composer...

Fields.DialogueText: O-oh... I guess if you have a while, we could talk. Casual conversation sounds nice.
Really? In that case, I hope you have a few minutes...
I don't even know where to begin.
I have plenty of free time, Fieramosca.
Good. I was worried that--
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Well, I'm no longer worried. I'll show you exactly where my place is!
I trust you, Capitano. It's the rest of us I'm still working on. But make no mistake: we are an us.
That's progress. Just keep it up.
Do you have time to chat, Capitano?
Surprised to see you drop in so suddenly. Come on in.
Thank you.
That conversation we had not too long ago... I wanted to thank you for it.

Fields.MenuText: No. Thank you, Fieramosca. I'm glad you got to unwind for a little bit.
I'm here to help, whatever my crew needs. It's how we win the war.
You've been under a lot of stress, Fieramosca. I just wanted to help.

Fields.DialogueText: I did. It helped clear my mind. I guess I never explained my irrational behavior from a while ago.
There's another reason for why I acted the way I did.
Think you could help me one more time?
What's the problem?
Some of the crew members were talking behind my back...
Really?
They called me Fieroguaio again.
I'll handle it. Do you happen to know where I can find them about now?
The mess. It's my problem, Capitano. You don't have to help if you don't want to.
*ALARM*
Consider it done. Let's make sure we're around to do it.
@BATTLE
Morganas inbound, Captain.
Get to your station. And someone find Fieramosca!
@BATTLE
I'm telling you, after we eat, I have to tell you more about my ideas for my movie.
Sure thing. Any progress on finding assistance?
I have an idea... wait. Do you see them?
The crew members sitting across from us?
They're the ones. Those are the ones giving me a hard time.
Is that so? Hey! You! Come over here!
Y-yes, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: I think you know why I called you over here. Apologize to the Belle, or else.
How about you stop bringing our most important ally's morale down? You better say you're sorry.
Unless you want to be dropped into the ocean, I suggest you and your friends apologize to our lovely Fieramosca.

Fields.DialogueText: Uh... I'm so sorry! Please forgive me! It won't happen again, I promise!
I apologize for my behavior, Captain. I wasn't thinking. Please forgive me, Fieramosca!
Fieramosca! Never again will I speak out of line! Find it in your beautiful soul to forgive me!
Umm... Apology accepted.
See? Problem solved.
Hmph. I appreciate it, Capitano. They might come to resent me for this, of course. I should be fighting my own battles.
Not with the crew, you shouldn't. I've talked to you plenty of times about that. I can talk to them too when necessary.
True enough. Now, picture the opening of my film. It's 1493, and the French have just invaded...
There are Morganas lurking, Capitano. I can feel them close by.
How close?
Too close. Melee distance, even.
@BATTLE
I think I found someone...
Found someone? What do you mean?
I found someone to help with my picture!
Who?
Another Italian Belle. She's a light cruiser, and passionate about her nation. Almost as loyal as I am.

Fields.MenuText: Hard to believe. How are you going to do this? Do you have a form of contact with her?
I'm glad to hear that. Is it too late to ask for a role in the film?
Hopefully this will keep your mood in a good state.

Fields.DialogueText: We write letters to one another daily. She has a decent idea of what to include.
It's a film focused on myself and the Italian lifestyle. I might be able to get you in a crowd scene.
I think it'll distract from some of the annoyances with the crew.
I didn't explicitly hear you say no to a potential cameo from yours truly.
No, you didn't. Nor did I say yes. Although...
Got a role in mind?
Let's not let it get to that point.
There's a big duel scene. The Challenge of Barletta, they called it. Thirteen Italians versus thirteen French. The Italians win, come ti aspetteresti.
Need someone to be one of the French? I've always wanted to play a villain.
One of them died during the fight. I could give you that one.
I'll take it.
You'd better! I can't find anyone on the crew who wants to play them.
Why ever not?
Something about being afraid I can't control myself. As if I don't every day on the battlefield...
You need to talk to some of your crew. They're hopeless.
Nothing is hopeless. What's gotten to you this time? Is the crew bullying you again?
The issue is that they believe in something as stupid as bad luck.
You don't believe in luck?
It's a bunch of nonsense, Capitano. They won't even let me mention my lucky number.
What is it?
Thirteen.

Fields.MenuText: I kind of expected that.
Really? Thirteen? Why?
I don't think I can do anything about superstition, Fieramosca.

Fields.DialogueText: Why did you expect that? What does that mean?
It has a nice ring to it. Why else?
I guess I can work with it. I just have to prove that the world's different now that I'm in it.
Surely you understand one person's good omen is another's bad one.
I wish they did! I've carried it with me in my heart for as long as I've been alive. Never once has it led me astray! Why can't they just learn to deal with me?
*ALARM*
You mean your lucky number.
Of course that's what I mean! What else could I be talking about? Now, then, hadn't we better get to our stations?
So close and yet so far...
@BATTLE
Is there anything to do on this ship!? What can I do!?
Whoa! Calm down! What's going on? Sit down and talk with me.
I hate being treated like a fragile creature. They all think I'm useless.
Who does?
The crew do. They all think I'm a coward.

Fields.MenuText: Why do you think doing nothing makes you cowardly?
I'm sure that they want you to rest. No one thinks you're a coward.
No one is out to get you, Fieramosca.

Fields.DialogueText: Doing nothing, sitting things out... you may as well surrender to the enemy yourself.
They do. Doing nothing proves how afraid you are!
They're all waiting for the moment to switch me out for someone better!
That's why you're afraid of sitting out on battles...
*ALARM*
General quarters, Capitano. I have to win the day where everyone can see.
@BATTLE
You do that all the time. What more do you want from yourself?
You're right. You know, I hear my sister Pola runs a fight club to keep herself sharp. I should look into that.
Haven't I told you that we shouldn't be fighting?
It's not fighting! It's training. Now, let me show you fighting...
You know, Fieramosca... you remind me a little of-
What? Looking for trouble again? Choose your words carefully, marinaio.
Calm down, Fieramosca. He's just trying to compliment you.
Right! You remind me of that  French submarine. What was her name... Surcouf! That's it.
Do I look French to you? What do you even mean by that?
I-I just mean-
What?! Speak up! Give me words to cram back down your throat!

Fields.MenuText: Fieramosca, I don't know what's gotten into you, but you're getting out of hand!
He obviously didn't mean any harm by that. You should apologize.
Calm down, Fieramosca. I'm sure he meant well.

Fields.DialogueText: Is it wrong to expect the worst when compared to the worst?
Fine...
Did he? It's hard to tell...
I- I was just saying you're so tenacious, and you don't take nonsense from anyone, and-
And I'd steal your soul if I thought I could sell it?
Gah!
Don't look at me like that, Capitano. It's the worst-kept secret in the entire ocean. She's a conniving serpent, and French besides.
So much for lightening the mood before a battle. Track him down and apologize once we're done.
Se insisti.
@BATTLE
I need some outside input.
That's what I'm here for. What are you looking for?
It's about my script. It's supposed to not only be about me, but the Italian way of life.
How do I fit into this?
I want to know what you'd want to do in Italy.
What I'd do in Italy? I mean... in what capacity?
It's not like I'm inviting you! What would you want to do first as a tourist?

Fields.MenuText: I guess I'd want to learn about the nation. Maybe visit some famous landmarks.
I'd eat at as many places as I can to experience the cuisine.
Experiencing the local way of life would be my first step.

Fields.DialogueText: Good choice. You've given me the answer I needed. Thank you, Capitano.
Eating? Really? That is all you'd want to experience? Well, I admit you've picked the right country for it.
Smart answer. That's all I needed.
I'm glad you trust me to help write your story. It should be a unique one.
Sono una Bella Fantasma! Of course it will be unique. I needed to get a sense of the mundane experience.
... Glad I could help.
*ALARM*
Ah, l'allarme. Now, if I could enlist your aid for a little longer...
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
All hands on deck!
@BATTLE
I wish we had some of the support the others are getting...
That's something we have to earn. Maybe if you were better at fixing me we'd earn it faster.
What do you mean by support?
Seaplanes. We need seaplanes. Imagine the advantages it would give us.
Bah! Not impressive! How could you think any Belle that has access to seaplanes is any better than me?!
We'd have better reconnaissance, for starters.

Fields.MenuText: Okay, that's enough. I need everyone to get along. The Morganas are the enemy.
Not another peep. Things are going smoothly. Don't cause any trouble.
Seaplanes could give us an advantage...

Fields.DialogueText: I didn't mean any harm. I wish our Belle was more open...
Sorry, Captain.
See? Think of how much easier battles would be!
What's the point of seeing an enemy coming if you can destroy it when it draws near?
You too, Fieramosca.
I can't help how I was built!
Exactly. So don't take it so personally.
Surcouf seems to do fine with her Besson...
Che cosa hai appena detto!?
Why don't you tell me all about your latest script revision?
Un'idea geniale! The culture will be good for this one's ears.
Oh, for God's sake...
Are you saying the picket ships aren't enough? Some of my best friends are picket ships!
Let them come, Capitano! I've been aching to take them to the tiltyard!
Morgana ambush!
How come no one saw this coming? I thought I was working with a talented crew!
We don't have time for arguing! We need to hold our ground!
@BATTLE
Ugh...how can I be expected to stay in top condition when you're all blind?!
Fieramosca!
You're all waiting for an excuse to put me down, aren't you?!
Fieramosca! Stop!
After all, why care about me when you can get a replacement French Belle!?

Fields.MenuText: That's enough! We were attacked by surprise! Everyone, give me a report on any potential damages!
No time to place the blame! It gets us nowhere!
Fieramosca! I expect better of you! You think your nation would accept this behavior?

Fields.DialogueText: Fine! But everyone better stay out of my way! It's because no one listens to me!
Really!? Why am I wasting my time? You know where I'll be, Capitano.
I... I... I'm going to be alone for a while.
Finally. I was beginning to think she'd never leave.
Watch it.
You're not seriously defending her.
I'm not. But let me handle her. As you were.
Captain. I-- whoa! Captain, the whole ship just tilted!
It's just a tantrum. I'll talk some sense into her.
It's not even that big of a deal...
Who are you talking to?
Why even try to explain how it doesn't change the battle?
Fieramosca, you okay?
Creativity wins wars. Not fancy weapons...
Capitano. I didn't see you.

Fields.MenuText: What were you talking to yourself about?
You seem stressed. Want to talk?
I can always come back another time.

Fields.DialogueText: It's ludicrous that the crew finds them so interesting! I'm way better!
About how the crew is easily swayed by shiny things?
No, it's fine! You're the only one who doesn't fall for it!
Are you talking about the seaplanes?
Nasty, noisy parassiti... they should all be rounded up and launched into the sun.
@BATTLE
Maybe if you ask politiely, I'll find you a derelict aircraft carrier to abuse.
... R-really?
The longer you survive, the better the odds of finding one. You might even blast one apart yourself.
There is that one Morgana carrier... the one who slinks around like it's contest night at the brothel.
I'll see if I can't get you a shot at one. If you're that worked up about planes, you should be taking your anger out on the ships carrying them. Not the crew.
Capisco. I'm sorry, Capitano.
Apologize on the battlefield. Then apologize to the crew.
*ALARM*
The crew appreciated your apology, Fieramosca.
What apology? I didn't do anything.
Really? You look like you've been busy.
And what is that supposed to mean? It's rude to remark on a lady's appearance, you know.
I know why you take things so seriously. You're afraid of letting down your country. Well, so are we.
... Not as afraid as I am.

Fields.MenuText: You don't have to worry about that. There's no way you could ever let them down.
It's a lot of pressure that you put on yourself. That's why you're strained. You have to take a step back.
We're all worried. We all feel pressured. But it's natural.

Fields.DialogueText: You think so? Capitano... I-I have to go do something...
Is that true? You may be right...
It doesn't feel it, but... thanks for the attempt, Capitano.
*ALARM*
Come on. You're one of a kind. Let's show them what you can do.
@BATTLE
My diet, my business.
Your food supplies finally came through. But I haven't noticed you eating as well as you like to boast you do.
So I was feeling generous. Qual è il tuo punto?
And yet I see the occasional sailor enjoying a massive olive. They had to get them from somewhere.
We are taking heavy fire, Captain.
Fieramosca, are you all right?
Just fine. Ready to teach these Morganas a thing or two.
@BATTLE
Captain, I thought I'd give you a status update on the vessel.

Fields.MenuText: I hope it's good news.
Can we just leave her be for a little bit? She's dealing with a lot.
Sure. What is it now?

Fields.DialogueText: It is. She's not getting as damaged as she used to against the Morganas.
But, Captain... She's better than ever.
She's as healthy as can be.
What do you mean?
Fieramosca is usually careless when it comes to keeping herself operational...
And?
She's somehow been more careful as of late. Fieramosca is operating at... well, top capacity.
What could've caused that?
I'm not sure. Was it something you could've said?
Something I said?
She listens to you, you know.
Could have fooled me.
I want to thank you, Capitano.
Thank me? What did I do?
You were right about me being afraid...
I was petrified of letting my nation down. I had failed so many missions... after the Spanish Civil War, I thought the Regia Marina might just give up on me.
Fieramosca...
I was frustrated. At everything. From the people who built me to our crew. I felt like I was one step away from being ripped apart to scrap metal... so I stopped caring if others felt that way.

Fields.MenuText: I don't think you're a failure. And I know you don't either.

Fields.DialogueText: It's easy to forget, Capitano. Especially... especially if...

Fields.MenuText: You know the crew only want to see you succeed. Even if they don't always express it very constructively.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, it takes one to recognize one. And buon dio onnipotente, do I recognize it.

Fields.MenuText: We need all the help we can get, Fieramosca. You're not going anywhere.

Fields.DialogueText: You'd have to scuttle me yourself if I were.
... Capitano. Can you petition the Regia Marina for my blueprints?
Eh? Whatever for?
I want to see what they had planned for... for my hangar.
I thought you hated seaplanes.
I'm... starting to see the value of curiosity, Capitano. Even if only to know why I ultimately choose spite.
Choose whatever you like. As long as you point it at the Morganas.
Spite's the best weapon of all. You might call it the only weapon that sharpens itself.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Come on!
The answer is no. I'm not one to change my mind.
I'm offering you a role in my script! You were itching to get on it before! Why are you rejecting me now?!
Because it deserves to be about you, Fieramosca.
Really? That... means a lot.

Fields.MenuText: Plus, I'd steal the show! I'm much more better looking!

Fields.DialogueText: You wish!
I know I've told you about my namesake before.

Fields.MenuText: With you leading the charge, the Morganas don't stand a chance.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, it'd be hard for me to lead anything without capitano and crew.

Fields.MenuText: Italy's lucky to have you. You don't just fight for your country - you want to show the world how great it is.

Fields.DialogueText: In and out of the fight.
Scourge of the French at Cerignola. Winner of the Challenge of Barletta. Lived fast and died a hero... and he truly earned his name.
You've been through a lot, Fieramosca. But you're all the stronger for it. I'd say you're earning your name as well.
His spirit lives in me. Though I may be... unwieldy at times... I know I am learning to work with what I have, and learn from it. The world is simply not yet ready for me.
The Morganas certainly aren't.
Shall we tell them so?
He was Ferramosca, originally. Fieramosca, after Barletta. "Fiera" meaning "proud." Not that he was vain, but because those who witnessed his deeds saw something to aspire to. His pride was theirs.
Ettore Fieramosca wasn't his real name?
Fieroguaio. Proud trouble.
Let's give them a bit of that... what do the crew call you?
Nessun problema, Capitano. I am... learning to tolerate it. Maybe even like it, one day soon.
Should I not have brought it up?
